intro: Erythroselinum atropurpureum, commonly known as purple carrot parsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green or yellow when mature. It thrives in temperate climates and prefers well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to gardens and herbal collections.
